intro: Peucedanum normanii, commonly known as Norman's angelica, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and fennel, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires protection.
